data.title: Good food, great neighbors.
data.text: I work across the street to Fera's and go there once in a while for lunch as I work across the street. The place has a small downtown quick lunch stop type vibe and I usually always order the same thing. The owner always remembers my order when I walk in. Its a friendly neighborhood stop that I enjoy.

data.title: Better options out there
data.text:
The food is okay, usually edible but not great. The problem I have with it is that the pricing seems a little sketchy. I went for a salad and got three different prices from two different workers. No surprise the final price ended up being the higher one. Not that a buck or so is a big deal, but $8 for a small-ish salad with commercial dressing and a few chicken pieces is a bit steep.

The owner also charges extra when you use a charge card. Seems unnecessary for the amount of volume he does, and considering the prices (see comments above). I too am in a small business that takes credit cards and I do not pass that cost along to my customers.

It is unfortunate that this is very close to my office building but questionable ethics and mediocre food make me not want to return.
